A Gantt chart is a graphical representation of a project schedule, named after Henry Gantt who developed this type of chart during the 1910s. No, the word "radar" is not a palindrome. A palindrome is a word, phrase, number, or other sequences of characters that reads the same forward and backward, ignoring spaces, punctuation, and capitalization. You should use fabric softener because machine washing puts a lot of mechanical pressure on textiles, especially natural fibers like cotton and wool. Beauty is not a substance, but it is a quality or characteristic that can be attributed to a substance or a person. It is a subjective experience and can vary from person to person. Therefore, beauty can be said to be related to a person or an object, but it is not a substance itself.

夜空は星の blanket (yozora wa hoshi no futon).

Literally, this means "the night sky was a blanket of stars," but because futon in Japanese also means a bed or a place to sleep, this phrase can be interpreted as a metaphor that the night sky is a comfortable and cozy place filled with stars where you can sleep.

「星 blanket のように、夜空が広がっていた。」 This sentence translates to "Just like a blanket, the night sky was spread with stars." In this case, the English word "blanket" is translated directly into Japanese as "blanket" and used as a noun, but the meaning is conveyed through the verb "spread" (広がる) and the context of the sentence.

「夜空は星の blanket」
(Yozora wa hoshi no futon)

Literally: "The night sky was a star blanket."

"Đêm trăn trời như một áo giưa sao." (The night sky is like a blanket of stars.)

In this metaphor, the night sky is compared to a blanket, and the stars are compared to tiny pieces of sao (stars or decorations) sewn onto the blanket. This creates a vivid and poetic image that conveys the beauty and sparkle of the night sky.

"Đêm lấp lánh bằng manta sao." This sentence literally translates to "The night was fully covered by a quilt of stars." This metaphor is used to convey the idea that the night sky was filled with a multitude of stars, creating a beautiful and breathtaking view, just like how a quilt is made up of many colorful pieces of fabric sewn together.

"Đêm trong là một chàn sao." (The night is a quilt of stars.)

In this metaphor, the night sky is compared to a cozy blanket that is filled with stars, suggesting a sense of peace, beauty, and vastness. The Vietnamese translation tries to convey the same meaning by using the word "chàn," which means a quilt or a thick blanket, and "sao," which means stars.

On the one hand, it can reduce transportation emissions and paper waste by allowing organizations to conduct business digitally and reducing the need for physical commuting and paper use. The name of the game is Uno.

In Uno, players take turns in a clockwise direction. Each player tries to get rid of all their cards by matching the top card of the discard pile in terms of color, number, or symbol. If a player cannot play a matching card, they must draw a card from the draw pile. If the drawn card can be played, the player can play it immediately.

The name of the game is Uno.

Uno is a popular card game typically played with 2 to 10 players. The objective of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all your cards. The game uses a special deck of 108 cards, consisting of four colors (red, green, blue, and yellow) and nine types of cards (0-9, Skip, Reverse, Draw Two, Wild, and Wild Draw Four).

La sharding d'une base de données est une méthode de partitionnement horizontale de vos données en plusieurs parties égales, appelées "shards", afin de les répartir sur plusieurs serveurs ou clusters de serveurs. Chaque shard contient une partie des données et est stocké sur un serveur différent. Cette méthode permet d'améliorer les performances et la scalabilité de la base de données

Le partitionnement de base de données, également connu sous le nom de sharding, est une méthode de scaling horizontale qui consiste à diviser une base de données volumineuse en plusieurs parties plus petites et à les répartir sur plusieurs serveurs ou clusters de serveurs. Chaque partie de la base de données, appelée shard, est stockée sur un serveur différent et gérée indépendamment.
